Hi,

Am Dienstag, 8. April 2003 22:27 schrieb javainsel:
> > Actually, I find that I'm spending even *larger* amounts of time
> > working
> > with my tests. I haven't measured, but I'd have to guess around
> > 70%.

> If testing time is so high, then who wants to blame me for looking
> for Parasoft JTest to make testing more productive?
It's not the testing time.
It's the time coding tests.

It's not possible to improve the testing time of JUnit.
It's only possible to improve the generation of Unit tests.
But as we already told you, DBC can't replace much of Unit testing, only small
parts of it.

The idea of TDD, especially at Extreme Programming Java with Junit, is, that
you write tests that force your classes to implement the business logic - use
cases and business objects - required to fulfill the customer's needs.
That's one more thing that can't be replaced by DBC.

> And you understand that DbC is not such a bad idea as some people
> here believe.
I can remember posts that show that in general DBC isn't a better solution
than Unit Testing.


Bye
